name: C Character Manipulations
description: Cheat Sheet for C character manipulation functions from ctype.h

Classification of characters.val: Returns true if c is a lower-case letter
Returns true if c is a upper-case letter
Returns true if c is an alphabetic character.
Returns true if c is alphanumeric (a letter or number)
Returns true if c is a decimal digit ('0' through '9')
Returns true if c is a hexadecimal digit
Returns true if c is is printable character other than space, letter, digit
Returns true if c is a whitespace character, i.e. space (' '), formfeed (\f), newline (\n), carriage return (\r), tab (\t), vertical tab (\v)
Returns true if c is a blank character, i.e. a space or a tab
Returns true if c is a graphic character, i.e. characters other than whitespace characters
Returns true if c is a printing character, i.e. all graphic characters, plus the space character
Returns true if c is a control character (character other than printing character)
Returns true if c is a 7-bit unsigned char value that fits into the US/UK ASCII character set. This function is a BSD extension and is also an SVID extension.

Case conversion.val: Returns the corresponding upper-case letter if c is upper-case
Returns the corresponding lower-case letter if c is lower-case
